Class MovieDatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
MovieDatabaseManager
public class MovieDatabaseManager extends Object
Handles all database operations for the Movie Data Management System (DMS).

This class uses a pre-established Connection to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the movies table. It acts as the data access layer between the GUI and the database itself.

Role in the System:

  • Manages SQL interactions for the application.
  • Provides methods for adding, reading, updating, and deleting Movie records.
  • Prevents the GUI layer from directly interacting with SQL code, ensuring separation of concerns.

Dependencies:

This class depends on an active Connection, which is typically created and validated through DBConnectionDialog.

Example Usage:


 // Assuming a valid java.sql.Connection object exists
 MovieDatabaseManager db = new MovieDatabaseManager(connection);
 ArrayList<Movie> movies = db.getAllMovies();

      public ArrayList<Movie> getAllMovies()
      Retrieves all movies stored in the database.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all Movie objects found in the database.

    • getMovieById

      public Movie getMovieById(int id)
      Retrieves a movie from the database by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the movie.
      Returns:
      a Movie object representing the selected movie, or null if not found.
